Key Match Events: Pete Crow-Armstrong and Isaac Paredes had run-scoring singles in a three-run eighth inning.
Porter Hodge pitched a perfect ninth for his ninth save in 12 chances.
Pre-Game Insights: Hendricks can become a free agent after completing a contract worth $70 million over five seasons.
Post-Match Reflections: Hendricks was hugged by teammates before leaving the mound, then got an ovation from the crowd of 38,180.
Hendricks plans to keep pitching and would like to stay with Chicago, but seems resigned to moving on to another team.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cubs beat the Cincinnati Reds 3-0 on Saturday.
Cincinnati has lost five in a row.
The Reds were shut out for the 16th time and held to three hits or fewer for the 20th time.
Others: Reds starter Rhett Lowder allowed three hits in five innings.
Cubs manager Craig Counsell sent pitching coach Tommy Hottovy to the mound to pull Hendricks after he reached 81 pitches.
